title: Why Is Gas So Expensive? Ukraine-Russia War Sparks Price Increases Across U.S.
sub_head: Invasion accelerated rise in already-climbing prices; national average tops $4 a gallon
body:
U.S. gasoline prices have reached records above $4 a gallon, a climb that threatens to hamper economic growth, lift already high inflation and cut down on summer road trips.
The reopening economy already had lifted prices from pandemic lows but the rise turned into a surge after Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine.
